text: Hello guys, would it be possible to achieve this layout (mainly the preview button next to the checkboxes) in HubSpot within Forms?

Hi Liam, hm maybe with JS and then injecting some CSS, that might be possible. But i think the more solid way is to create a html form yourself and then send the form data via API, but that´s just my personal preference.

Thanks Andreas. That sounds like a good plan, but in my case, I would like to stay away from handling the form submission manually since the client will have their own workflow for that part. I would love to hear more about the option with JS and CSS injections, could you explain a bit more? The preview button will basically be just a link to another page, but I didn’t find an good way to put the link next to the checkboxes in the Form, should I define them as the fields of my custom module, and then mapping them via JS, and if so, how?
<@UA5DFM7CK> were you ever able to get this working? I am facing the same problem now
I guess it would be nice to know what happens when you make a module global... There must be some database reference for the global content

<@UG7S8J18D> Yep! I was able to find a work around for this issue.  When the module is converted (locally) from a global to a local module, each field type group within the module as the toggle in the Editor Options to Prevent editing in content editors flipped on.  I had to go into each group and flip them all off. That did the trick.
